author: mini_mads1980
title: Nice Small Bulldozer
review:
Overview

Issue 25 of the Lego City Comic comes with a small bulldozer build and Carl Concrete.  The set contains 27 pieces and is a nice little build that younger kids are sure to enjoy.

Packet

The image of the Carl and the bulldozer on the front of the foil packet shows the set well.  I think all four wheels maybe should have been on the ground to ensure that the bulldozer works to its full potential.  Carl seems pretty happy with himself and in the background there is a tower crane and large construction project. 

It also states on the front that this is a limited edition and it is for ages 5+.  I think this is too high, especially as the only other City Construction set this year is the 4+ 60252 Construction Bulldozer which this set compliments.

The back has the standard safety information, which includes a symbol saying it's not ages 0-3 and the 1:1 image is of one of the two 1x1 Reddish Brown round plates included within the set that imitate the mud.

Minifigure

Considering the set is called Eddy Erker with Bulldozer I was a little surprised to see that the comic calls the construction worker Carl Concrete.  His torso and legs last appeared in City Construction sets in 60152: Sweeper & Excavator from 2017.  His head currently appears in 28 sets and the white hat he wears is in 22 sets.  I always think you should get an extra hair element for the sets on the comics to add playability.

Main Build/Parts

The build is simple enough for just over 20 parts.  The only part you can't see from the front of the packet is a 1X2 transparent red plate used at the back of the bulldozer.  I think the wheels on this are too wide for a set of this size and the spoiler piece used at the front seems too small.  A proper seat could have added to the set as well, but it is ok without.

There are no parts that are super rare, however the spoiler used at the front only appears in 14 sets in this colour.

Verdict

Certainly a huge improvement on the last offering, but minor changes could improve it.  It is good to get a couple of extra parts to use as the mud, even if it is only two 1x1 studs.  This is a fun little set which is exactly what these comics should be about.  This is only the second time we have had a construction set on the comics since Issue 2!

If you can get this then I certainly recommend it.  A version of this could be made quite simply from most collections if you can't get hold of one as most of the parts are very common. 

Inside the back of the comic it shows that we will get two Minifigures with Issue 26 - a policeman and crook.
